titleStmt.title: Palladis tamia Wits treasury being the second part of Wits common wealth. By Francis Meres Maister of Artes of both vniuersities.
titleStmt.author: Meres, Francis, 1565-1647.
N. L. (Nicholas Ling), fl. 1580-1607.
N. L. (Nicholas Ling), fl. 1580-1607. Politeuphuia.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by P. Short, for Cuthbert Burbie, and are to be solde at his shop at the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Number 2 in the "Wits" series, presented as a sequel to "Politeuphuia wits common wealth" by Nicholas Ling.

Contents of the first gathering: A1, title page; A2-4, dedication and Latin note by the author, normally cancelled, not included in pagination above; A5-7, list of authors; A8 either blank (unattested) or the cancel for B1, not included in pagination above. Variant 1: A2-4 present.
B1 is a cancel; B1v begins "deny he liueth". Variant: B1 uncancelled; B1v begins "deny him to be".
Running title reads: The second part of Wits common-wealth.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 217 (title page in pen facsimile) and at reel 287 (title page supplied from STC 17836).

place.placeName: his shop at the Royall Exchange
